title: Does God really exist? Wouldn't there be nothing wrong in the world if there was God? - Quora

response.answer_text: The existence of God is one of the most profound philosophical inquiries and has been since the beginning of man. The question has been studied by some of the greatest thinkers and philosophers throughout history and no answer goes without debate. As time has gone by, ideas and beliefs about God have played a major part in human life. They've provided answers to unalterable questions, and given man a way of life as well as a reason to live. Yet even with the idea of God, there's such an influential part of human life, can we be sure that God does exist? The main reason people tend to lose faith in God is because the concept of God seems to be incompatible with the existence of evil. We understand God to be a perfect being an all-powerful, all-knowing, and all-loving creator of the heavens and the earth, with the existence of such a being how can any type of evil possibly exist. So is the problem of evil, the reason to dismiss the concept of God or even the existence of God? Major philosophical arguments for and against the existence of God: The ontological argument attempts to prove the existence of God through logic, but is logic enough to prove God’s existence? Followed by the teleological argument otherwise known as the design argument. This theory states that the intricacy and complexity of our world and universe could not have come about by chance, it was in fact designed. If the world in the universe was designed, it needs a designer and this designer is God. So, we question: can our intricate planet have come about without a design? Finally, we have the cosmological argument, the idea that cause and effect is proof of the existence of God. He holds that everything that exists needs a cause for its existence and because the universe exists, it also needs a cause and this cause is God. So we question: Is it in fact possible for the universe to exist without actually having a cause? ^^This is how philosophers tried to understand the concept of God. However, I personally believe that “God” cannot be understood by the rational human mind, but through faith. That it’s “something” you choose to follow or believe blindly without any proof of its existence (keep in mind that I’m not referring to God as a person or a thing, when using the pronoun “it”). For instance, when you (a believer or a non-believer) are in times of trouble, you look up and seek for help unconsciously and at that moment arises a faith, that someone in some shape or form is watching you. So, how can this be explained? In like manner, people have EXPERIENCED unexplainable events in their lives, which they believe are God’s doing. Nevertheless, this is a question that no one knows the answer to!!!

The reason God took that away was because Adam and Eve sinned against him. He then was forced to kick them out of the garden and put Angels with fire swords to guard the entrance. From then on there was pain in childbirth, the shame of nakedness, the knowing of right and wrong, and much more. God didn’t intend for us to be kicked out, but he knew Adam and Eve’s sin would force him to banish them. So, to this day we live in a broken world, where people know what is the difference between right and wrong and choose to do the wrongs. That is what I like to call a fallen world. God chooses us to work in him and strive to complete his goal to finish what he started: The gospel. You might ask, then why doesn’t God just end this and make everybody go to heaven? It doesn’t work like that. God cannot make you go to heaven. If he did that he would be destroying his just character. Beyond that, we must seek after God, and maybe ask him in heaven someday. GODSPEED through your journey with Christ, B. Johnson

Does God really exist? Wouldn't there be nothing wrong in the world if there was God? We assume that life on earth is the main life and blame God for not making it easier for us; that is a wrong assumption. We are in a temporary primary stage like the children who were asked to learn reading and writing but those kids struggle to understand the rocket science. In our temporary stage, we have been asked to obey God and to do good deeds to help others, but we are debating what we cannot comprehend like ‘who is God’, soul, or ‘what is afterlife’. We are here for testing; test environment necessitates struggle between desires and obedience, between good and evil. Testing missions are not supposed to be fair, easy, or comfortable. The test questions are not supposed to be known in advance. The wealthy father has the right to test his sons before distributing the wealth The wise father disciplines his children and prepares them for a better life The obedient son who takes care of others should be rewarded better than the disobedient son who persecutes others. Psalm 66:10 teaches ‘For You, O God, have tested us; You have refined us as silver is refined’ Proverbs 17:3 teaches ‘The refining pot is for silver and the furnace for gold, but God tests the hearts’ Isaiah 48:10 teaches ‘I have refined you, but not as silver is refined. Rather, I have refined you in the furnace of suffering’ Job 23:10 teaches ‘when he has tested me, I will come forth as gold’ Qur’an verse 47:31 clarifies that we are here for testing And We will surely test you until We make evident those who strive among you [for the cause of God] and the patient, and We will test your affairs Verse 29:2-3 confirms that we are here for testing Do the people think that they will be left to say, "We believe" and they will not be tried? But We have certainly tried those before them, and God will surely make evident those who are truthful, and He will surely make evident the liars. Similar teachings are found in 67:2, 18:7, 2:155 and 76:2 Regardless of how successful we are with our personal objectives; we cannot have inner peace without addressing the high-level objective; the purpose of our existence. It is wrong to say ‘let us enjoy the journey and forget about the destination’ If you find yourself in a train, you should not enjoy the beautiful scenes before first ask: why am I here? Where is the destination? We should first ask ‘what is the purpose of life?’ What is the value of life if we do not know the purpose of that life? It is the greatest good for an individual to discuss virtue every day... for the un-examined life is not worth living – Socrates Our life on earth is a very short period compared to the universe time scale; It could be a temporary test period. There are hundreds of verses and teachings about that as mentioned in the following answer: https://www.quora.com/How-do-we-know-our-purpose-of-existence-in-this-world/answer/Sabri-Shahin We have been asked to believe in God and Heaven but we have not seen God or heaven. Our fate will be determined based on that belief and on our good deeds. Why did God make it a difficult test for us? Although God knows what’s in our hearts and what each of us might do, he tests us and wants us to witness our own test results in order to admit that we have been fairly rewarded according to our achievements as recorded in the test results Before the wealthy father distributes his wealth, he may want to record which son is obedient, the records are not for the father who knows, but as a testimony for people who might question the justice of their father Although the wise teacher knows the hard-working student and the lazy student, he prepares regular exams as testimonies so that the students would not say that the teacher had favored some students over the others. Exams also urge students to get prepared in order to succeed The student is not supposed to rejoice and enjoy himself during the exam hours Students should not wonder about the intention of the teacher; they are supposed to focus on what the teacher asked them to do If God wants to set up the testing environment to test people, then we are not supposed to advise God on how to set up the terms and conditions of the testing. The students are not supposed to advise the teacher on how to prepare the exams. God has created us, and he knows how to test us. The testing questions and answers are not supposed to be disclosed before the exam; testing environment necessitates some doubts and enables different choices and different decisions. The test does not depend on the level of education, a child may say ‘I do not see the plane any more, it is going far away, it is still there but my sight does not reach it; God must be there but my sight does not reach him’, but a scientist might conclude that, ‘I do not see God, then there is no God’. The test does not depend on the level of religion education, maybe someone who never heard of the religion teachings could pass the test based on the natural original gifts of conscience and reason ‘What I do not want done to myself, I will not do to others. We may find some scholars who know the religion teachings but they accept to persecute and torture others, those are the bad trees which the prophets have warned us of them and of their bad fruits. The wise teacher sets different evaluation criteria for different grades; the students in the first grade are not evaluated as the students in the advanced degrees. We expect that the fair and wise God would evaluate people according to what they have been provided. The person who never heard of Prophets would have an easier test based on the gift of intelligence and conscience; he might get rewards for his good works and he might not be punished if not wicked. God has empowered each of us to be happy and blessed. God does not predetermine bad plans for good people. God does not predetermine good plans for disobedient people. We see many people born poor but have succeeded in life We see many people born rich but failed in life God has empowered us to do and get whatever we want. God has delegated that task to us, it is up to us to be blessed or to be cursed. The message that God has revealed to all prophets is: ‘Blessings for obedience and curses for disobedience’ All prophets taught that we can earn salvation by obedience, repentance, and good deeds to help others. “In obedience and repentance is your salvation” Isaiah 30:15 Based on the above, the obedient believer should be blessed in this life and should be saved in the afterlife. That is the truth which should set you free. For those who have doubts, they can ask God. All prophets have urged us to ask God and taught that God would answer us. Do not worry about how you will receive and understand the answer; God has created us and he knows how to convey his message to us.
